webwork-tex.statement: Find the line integral with respect to arc length \(\displaystyle \int_C (3 x + 4 y) ds\), where \(C\) is the line segment in the \(xy\)-plane with endpoints \(P = \left(8,0\right)\) and \(Q = \left(0,9\right)\). \leavevmode\\\relax \leavevmode\\\relax (a) Find a vector parametric equation \(\vec{r}(t)\) for the line segment \(C\) so that points \(P\) and \(Q\) correspond to \(t = 0\) and \(t = 1\), respectively. \leavevmode\\\relax \(\vec{r}(t) =\) \mbox{\parbox[t]{15ex}{\hrulefill}} \leavevmode\\\relax \leavevmode\\\relax (b) Using the parametrization in part (a), the line integral with respect to arc length is \leavevmode\\\relax \(\displaystyle \int_C (3 x + 4 y) ds = \int_a^b\) \mbox{\parbox[t]{20ex}{\hrulefill}} \(dt\) \leavevmode\\\relax with limits of integration \(a =\) \mbox{\parbox[t]{5ex}{\hrulefill}} and \(b =\) \mbox{\parbox[t]{5ex}{\hrulefill}} \leavevmode\\\relax \leavevmode\\\relax (c) Evaluate the line integral with respect to arc length in part (b). \leavevmode\\\relax \(\displaystyle \int_C (3 x + 4 y) ds =\) \mbox{\parbox[t]{20ex}{\hrulefill}}
